content:
Diagnosis:	Right breast cancer - Grade 2 acinic cell carcinoma, pT2N1mi(0.8mm)M0

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the breast oncology follow-up clinic. She is now 4 months post completion of adjuvant chemotherapy with 4 cycles of docetaxel/cyclophosphamide which she completed on March 15th 2024. She underwent right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy on November 12th 2023, which showed a 3.2cm Grade 2 acinic cell carcinoma with 0.8mm micrometastasis in one sentinel node. Immunohistochemistry confirmed AR and GATA3 positivity, HER2 negative disease.

She has made an excellent recovery from her chemotherapy and reports gradually improving energy levels. Her chemotherapy-related alopecia is resolving well with good hair regrowth. She describes occasional mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips but this is not impacting her daily activities. She has returned to work part-time and is steadily building up her hours.

She commenced adjuvant tamoxifen 20mg daily in April 2024 and is tolerating this well with only mild hot flushes. She understands the importance of continuing this for 5 years. She has been referred to the local exercise program and is gradually increasing her physical activity.

The plan is to continue current management with tamoxifen. She will have annual mammography surveillance, with the first due in November 2024. We will review her again in 3 months' time in the nurse-led follow-up clinic. She has the breast care nurse contact details should she have any concerns in the interim.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: AR positive, GATA3 positive, HER2 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

patient_facts.value: Occasional mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips, not impacting daily activities
Returned to work part-time and steadily building up hours

status_updates.value: Early breast cancer post surgery and adjuvant chemotherapy, now on hormonal therapy with good recovery and improving functional status
Resolving alopecia with good hair regrowth, mild peripheral neuropathy
Continuing tamoxifen 20mg daily with good tolerability
Review in 3 months in nurse-led follow-up clinic
